title.narrative: Swiss contact - women and youth's economic empowerment
Swisscontact - kvinnor och ungdomars ekonomiska egenmakt

description.narrative:
Insatsen är en uppstartsfas för ett projekt inom marknadssystemutveckling som ska bidra till urfolkskvinnor och ungdomars ekonomiska egenmakt i Guatemala. Resultaten från uppstartsfasen kommer att ligga till grund för ett fullskaligt projektförslag för ekonomisk inkludering av traditionellt exkluderade grupper i regionen Alta Verapaz.
De teman som kommer att undersökas genom insatsen är urfolkskvinnor och ungdomars: a) socioekonomiska situation, b) utvecklingsmöjligheter t ex inom utbildning, c) tillgång till finansiering, d) tillgång till stöd för egen verksamhet, e) möjligheter till arbetstillfällen med anständiga arbetsvillkor, f) möjligheter till förbättrad levnadssituation genom förbättrade arbetsvillkor. Insatsen kommer att studera hur gapet mellan målgruppens kompetens och de kompetenskrav som marknaden ställer kan minska, hur den lokala ekonomin i Alta Verapaz kan stärkas, samt hur tillgång till sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och rättigheter kan stärkas hos målgruppen.
Resultatet av insatsen kommer att ligga till grund för ett flerårigt projekt för marknadssystemutveckling med syfte att förbättra levnadssituationen för urfolkskvinnor och ungdomar genom ekonomisk inkludering och ökad tillgång till sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och rättigheter.

The initiative is an inception phase for a long-term project of market systems development that will contribute to indigenous women and young people's economic empowerment in Guatemala. The results of the inception phase will form the basis for a full-scale project proposal for the economic inclusion of traditionally excluded groups in the Alta Verapaz region.
The topics that will be examined through the contribution are indigenous women and youth's: (a) the socio-economic situation, (b) development opportunities such as education, c) access to funding, d) access to self-support for auto-employment; d) job-opportunities with decent working conditions, e) opportunities for improved living conditions through improved working conditions. The contribution aim at studying how the gap between the target group's skills and competencies that the market requires can be reduced, how the local economy in Alta Verapaz can be strengthened and how to increase access to sexual and reproductive health and rights for the target group.
The result of the contribution will form the basis of a multiannual market systems development project aimed at improving the living conditions of indigenous women and young people through economic inclusion and increased access to sexual and reproductive health and rights.

tag.narrative: 5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.
8.6 - By 2020, substantially reduce the proportion of youth not in employment, education or training.
8.6 - Till 2020 väsentligt minska den andel ungdomar som varken arbetar eller studerar.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: This inception phase served as a basis for a long-term project in employment with a market systems development method applied with the purpose of contributing to indigenous women and young people's economic empowerment and increased economic inclusion in the region of Alta Verapaz, Guatemala. The topics that were examined in the inception phase are, indigenous women and youth's: (a) socio-economic situation, (b) development opportunities such as education, c) access to funding, d) access to self-support for self-employment; d) job-opportunities with decent working conditions, e) opportunities for improved living conditions through improved working conditions. The studies also included how he gap between the target group's skills and competencies that the market requires can be reduced, how the local economy in Alta Verapaz can be strengthened and how to increase access to sexual and reproductive health and rights for the target group recognising the limited acces a barrier to economic inclusion. By the end of the inception phase a multiannual market systems development/employment project aimed at improving the living conditions of indigenous women and young people through economic inclusion and increased access to sexual and reproductive health and rights was formulated and submitted to Sida. The overall objective of the project is to increase employment opportunities for indigenous women and youth in 12 municipalities in Alta Verapaz through labour insertion, professional technical training, strengthened entrepreneur skills, mitigation of gender based violence and increased respect for and knowledge about sexual and reproductive health and rights. The purpose will be achieved through work in three components creating systemic effects: 1) the improvement of professional technical training and labour insertion, 2) the promotion of sustainable entrepreneurship and financial inclusion, and 3) the empowerment of women through increased respect for and knowledge of sexual and reproductive health, gender-based violence prevention and education in care economy. The interventions in these three components seek to introduce specific changes in the market system that, according to the theory of change, will lead to the expected improvements in the living conditions of the target group.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
